page.title: 14MOSSLEY CENTENARY FESTIVAL
page.content: Mossley people have never really accepted the fact that after local government re-organisation in 1975 they were residents of Tameside. It was the ideal opportunity therefore in 1985 to demonstrate their independence by celebrating the Centenary of the Granting of Mossley's Charter as a Borough in 1885. From 20th April until 12th May celebrations were held throughout the town in pubs, clubs, churches and homes. The death of Mr. Robbie Brooks, the Festival President, shortly before the Festival was a blow to everyone. Robbie had been the Chairman of the first Festival Committee and such was his stature as President that the Committee has been unable to find anyone suitable to fill the position.
